23  
24  package com.dd.plist;
25  
26  import java.io.IOException;
27  import java.text.ParseException;
28  import java.text.SimpleDateFormat;
29  import java.util.Date;
30  import java.util.TimeZone;
31  
32  /**
33   * Represents a date.
34   *
35   * @author Daniel Dreibrodt
36   */
37  public class NSDate extends NSObject {
38  
39      private Date date;
40  
41      // EPOCH = new SimpleDateFormat("yyyy MM dd zzz").parse("2001 01 01 GMT").getTime();
42      // ...but that's annoying in a static initializer because it can throw exceptions, ick.
43      // So we just hardcode the correct value.
44      private final static long EPOCH = 978307200000L;
45  
46      private static final SimpleDateFormat sdfDefault = new SimpleDateFormat("yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'");
47      private static final SimpleDateFormat sdfGnuStep = new SimpleDateFormat("yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss Z");
48  
49      static {
50          sdfDefault.setTimeZone(TimeZone.getTimeZone("GMT"));
51          sdfGnuStep.setTimeZone(TimeZone.getTimeZone("GMT"));
52      }
53  
54      /**
55       * Parses the XML date string and creates a Java Date object from it.
56       * This function is synchronized as SimpleDateFormat is not thread-safe.
57       *
58       * @param textRepresentation The date string as found in the XML property list
59       * @return The parsed Date
60       * @throws ParseException If the given string cannot be parsed.
61       * @see SimpleDateFormat#parse(java.lang.String)
62       */
63      private static synchronized Date parseDateString(String textRepresentation) throws ParseException {
64          try {
65              return sdfDefault.parse(textRepresentation);
66          } catch (ParseException ex) {
67              return sdfGnuStep.parse(textRepresentation);
68          }
69      }
70  
71      /**
72       * Generates a String representation of a Java Date object. The string
73       * is formatted according to the specification for XML property list dates.
74       *
75       * @param date The date which should be represented.
76       * @return The string representation of the date.
77       */
78      private static synchronized String makeDateString(Date date) {
79          return sdfDefault.format(date);
80      }
81  
82      /**
83       * Generates a String representation of a Java Date object. The string
84       * is formatted according to the specification for GnuStep ASCII property
85       * list dates.
86       *
87       * @param date The date which should be represented.
88       * @return The string representation of the date.
89       */
90      private static synchronized String makeDateStringGnuStep(Date date) {
91          return sdfGnuStep.format(date);
92      }
93  
94      /**
95       * Creates a date from its binary representation.
96       *
97       * @param bytes The date bytes
98       */
99      public NSDate(byte[] bytes) {
100         //dates are 8 byte big-endian double, seconds since the epoch
101         date = new Date(EPOCH + (long) (1000 * BinaryPropertyListParser.parseDouble(bytes)));
102     }
103 
104     /**
105      * Parses a date from its textual representation.
106      * That representation has the following pattern: <code>yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'</code>
107      *
108      * @param textRepresentation The textual representation of the date (ISO 8601 format)
109      * @throws ParseException When the date could not be parsed, i.e. it does not match the expected pattern.
110      */
111     public NSDate(String textRepresentation) throws ParseException {
112         date = parseDateString(textRepresentation);
113     }
114 
115     /**
116      * Creates a NSDate from a Java Date
117      *
118      * @param d The date
119      */
120     public NSDate(Date d) {
121         if (d == null)
122             throw new IllegalArgumentException("Date cannot be null");
123         date = d;
124     }
125 
126     /**
127      * Gets the date.
128      *
129      * @return The date.
130      */
131     public Date getDate() {
132         return date;
133     }
134 
135     @Override
136     public boolean equals(Object obj) {
137         return obj.getClass().equals(getClass()) && date.equals(((NSDate) obj).getDate());
138     }
139 
140     @Override
141     public int hashCode() {
142         return date.hashCode();
143     }
144 
145     @Override
146     void toXML(StringBuilder xml, int level) {
147         indent(xml, level);
148         xml.append("<date>");
149         xml.append(makeDateString(date));
150         xml.append("</date>");
151     }
152 
153     @Override
154     public void toBinary(BinaryPropertyListWriter out) throws IOException {
155         out.write(0x33);
156         out.writeDouble((date.getTime() - EPOCH) / 1000.0);
157     }
158 
159     /**
160      * Generates a string representation of the date.
161      *
162      * @return A string representation of the date.
163      * @see java.util.Date#toString()
164      */
165     @Override
166     public String toString() {
167         return date.toString();
168     }
169 
170     @Override
171     protected void toASCII(StringBuilder ascii, int level) {
172         indent(ascii, level);
173         ascii.append("\"");
174         ascii.append(makeDateString(date));
175         ascii.append("\"");
176     }
177 
178     @Override
179     protected void toASCIIGnuStep(StringBuilder ascii, int level) {
180         indent(ascii, level);
181         ascii.append("<*D");
182         ascii.append(makeDateStringGnuStep(date));
183         ascii.append(">");
184     }
185 }
